i18n.description: If translations will be provided via files, e.g. in admin/i18n/de/translations.json or provide the path to the i18n folder if it's custom or provide the translations inside this attribute as an object

step.description: Step size for increase and decrease buttons

variant.description: If button is outlined, contained or text

controlStyle.description: Style of the button or control itself

trim.description: If text must be trimmed or not (default = true)

readOnly.description: Shows text as read only field

copyToClipboard.description: Shows copy to clipboard button, but only if disabled or read-only

noClearButton.description: Do not show a clear button

minRows.description: default is 1. Set this attribute to `2` or more if you want to have a textarea with more than one row

maxRows.description: max rows of textarea. Used only if `minRows` > 1

time.description: If true, the text will be shown as time. The value is readonly automatically

name.description: Component name that will be provided via props, like ComponentInstancesEditor

bundlerType.description: If module written with TypeScript, set it to `module`. From Admin 7.5.x

custom.description: Custom properties for the component as an object

certificatesProps.description: Universal type that manages `certPublic`, `certPrivate`, `certChained` and `leCollection` attributes

encrypted.description: Is value encrypted or not (of course only for texts)

repeat.description: Password must be compared with password

visible.description: True if allow to view the password by toggling the view button

readOnly.description: The read-only flag. Visible is automatically true if readOnly is true

instance.description: Check if the instance is alive. If not defined, it will be used current instance. You can use `${data.number}` pattern in the text.

textAlive.description: Default text is `Instance %s is alive`, where `%s` will be replaced by `ADAPTER.0`

textNotAlive.description: Default text is `Instance %s is not alive`, where `%s` will be replaced by `ADAPTER.0`

data.description: The data to be encoded in the QR Code

size.description: The size of the QR code

complex.description: Show CRON with "minutes", "seconds" and so on

jsonData.description: Data to be sent as parsable string, can contain special placeholder. E. g. '{"subject1": "${data.subject}", "options1": {"host": "${data.host}"}}'

data.description: Data to be sent as JSON.

useNative.description: if adapter returns result with `native` attribute it will be used for configuration. If `saveConfig` is true, the user will be requested to save the configuration

showProcess.description: Show spinner while request is in progress

openUrl.description: if true - open URL in new tab, if response contains attribute openUrl, like {"openUrl": "http://1.2.3.4:80/aaa", "window": "_blank", "saveConfig": true}. If saveConfig is true, the user will be requested to save the configuration.

onLoaded.description: if true - execute the button logic once initially

window.description: if `openUrl` is true, this is a name of the new window. Could be overwritten if response consist `window` attribute. It is not the title of the new window!

controlStyle.description: Style of the button or control itself

timeout.description: timeout for request in ms. Default: none.

oid.description: Which object ID should be taken for the controlling. The ID is without "adapter.X." prefix

system.description: IF true, the state will be taken from system.adapter.XX.I. and not from XX.I

control.description: How the value of the state should be shown

controlled.description: If false, the control will be read only

trueText.description: This text will be shown if the value is true

trueTextStyle.description: Style of the text if the value is true

falseText.description: This text will be shown if the value is false

falseTextStyle.description: Style of the text if the value is false

trueImage.description: This image will be shown if the value is true. It could be base64 or URL

falseImage.description: This image will be shown if the value is false. It could be base64 or URL

min.description: Minimum value for number or slider

max.description: Maximum value for number or slider

controlDelay.description: Delay in ms between the change and the command

variant.description: Show spinner while request is in progress

readOnly.description: Defines if the control is read-only. Applied only to 'input', 'slider', 'select', 'button', 'switch', 'number'

foreign.description: The 'oid' is absolute and no need to add 'adapter.X' or 'system.adapter.X.' to oid

narrow.description: With this flag, the value will appear just after the label

blinkOnUpdate.description: Value should blink when updated (true or color). Only texts

size.description: Font size: small, normal, large or number

addColon.description: Add to label the colon at the end if not exist in label

buttonValue.description: Optional value, that will be sent for button

showEnterButton.description: Show SET button. The value in this case will be sent only when the button is pressed. You can define the text of the button. Default text is "Set" (Only for "input", "number" or "slider")

setOnEnterKey.description: The value in this case will be sent only when the "Enter" button is pressed. It can be combined with `showEnterButton`

adapter.description: Name of the adapter. With special name _dataSources you can get all adapters with flag common.getHistory

adapters.description: Optional list of adapters as array of strings, that should be shown. If not defined, all adapters will be shown. Only active if adapter attribute is not defined.

allowDeactivate.description: If true. Additional option "deactivate" is shown

onlyEnabled.description: If true. Only enabled instances will be shown

long.description: Value will look like system.adapter.ADAPTER.0 and not ADAPTER.0

short.description: Value will look like 0 and not ADAPTER.0

all.description: Add to the options ALL option with value *

types.description: Filter for one of the possible types: 'channel', 'device', ... (is state by default)

root.description: Show only this root object and its children

customFilter.description: Cannot be used together with `types` settings. Example: `{type: ['channel', 'device']}` - show only channels and devices

saveTokenIn.description: State name where the token will be saved. Default is 'oauth2Tokens'. The path is relative to the adapter instance, like 'adapterName.X.oauth2Tokens'

identifier.description: OAuth2 service identifier. Only known services are supported

scope.description: Optional scopes divided by space, e.g. `user-read-private user-read-email`

refreshLabel.description: Button label for refreshing the token

pattern.description: File extension pattern. Allowed '**/*.ext' to show all files from sub-folders too, '*.ext' to show from root folder or 'folderName/*.ext' to show all files in sub-folder folderName. Default '**/*.*'

objectID.description: Object ID of type meta. You can use special placeholder '%INSTANCE%': like 'myAdapter.%INSTANCE%.files'

upload.description: path, where the uploaded files will be stored. Like 'folderName'. If not defined, no upload field will be shown. To upload in the root, set this field to '/'

refresh.description: Show refresh button near the select

withFolder.description: show folder name even if all files in same folder

noSize.description: Do not show size of files

format.description: Format passed to the date picker

views.description: Configure which views should be shown to the users

timeSteps.description: Represent the available time steps for each view

returnFormat.description: Use `fullDate` or `HH:mm:ss`. Defaults to full date for backward compatibility reasons.

ignoreInternal.description: do not show internal interfaces (normally it is 127.0.0.1 too)

divider.description: divider between latitude and longitude. Default "," (Used if longitudeName and latitudeName are not defined)

autoInit.description: init field with current coordinates if empty

longitudeName.description: if defined, the longitude will be stored in this attribute, divider will be ignored

latitudeName.description: if defined, the latitude will be stored in this attribute, divider will be ignored

useSystemName.description: if defined, the checkbox with "Use system settings" will be shown and latitude, longitude will be read from system.config, a boolean will be saved to the given name

validateJson.description: if false, the text will be not validated as JSON

allowEmpty.description: if true, the JSON will be validated only if the value is not empty

doNotApplyWithError.description: Do not allow to save the value if error in JSON or JSON5

doNotSaveProp.description: Do not save this attribute as used only for internal calculations

iconPositionProp.description: Only for panels that has `icon` attribute.

allowAddByFilterProp.description: If add allowed even if filter is set

alsoDependsOnSendProp.description: Depends on other attributes and will be re-calculated when other attributes changed

noInternalProp.description: Do not show internal IP addresses

system.description: Allow the usage of the system language from system.config as default

jsonData.description: Data to be sent as parsable string, can contain special placeholder. E. g. '{"subject1": "${data.subject}", "options1": {"host": "${data.host}"}}'

data.description: Data to be sent as JSON.

freeSolo.description: Set freeSolo to true so the textbox can contain any arbitrary value.

jsonData.description: Data to be sent as parsable string, can contain special placeholder. E. g. '{"subject1": "${data.subject}", "options1": {"host": "${data.host}"}}'

data.description: Data to be sent as JSON.

jsonData.description: Data to be sent as parsable string, can contain special placeholder. E. g. '{"subject1": "${data.subject}", "options1": {"host": "${data.host}"}}'

data.description: Data to be sent as JSON.

jsonData.description: Data to be sent as parsable string, can contain special placeholder. E. g. '{"subject1": "${data.subject}", "options1": {"host": "${data.host}"}}'

data.description: Data to be sent as JSON.

pattern.description: File extension pattern. Allowed '**/*.ext' to show all files from sub-folders too, '*.ext' to show from root folder or 'folderName/*.ext' to show all files in sub-folder folderName. Default '**/*.*'

objectID.description: Object ID of type meta. You can use special placeholder '%INSTANCE%': like 'myAdapter.%INSTANCE%.files'

upload.description: path, where the uploaded files will be stored. Like 'folderName'. If not defined, no upload field will be shown. To upload in the root, set this field to '/'

refresh.description: Show refresh button near the select

withFolder.description: show folder name even if all files in same folder

noSize.description: Do not show size of files

crop.description: If true, allow user to crop the image (only for non svg)

square.description: Width must be equal to height or crop must allow only square as shape

#include.description: Include other JSON or JSON5 file. Here is the name of the file with extension. E.g. 'options.jsonConfig.json' for 'anyName.jsonConfig.json5'

crop.description: If true, allow user to crop the image (only for non svg)

square.description: Width must be equal to height or crop must allow only square as shape

base64.description: If true, the image will be saved as data-url in attribute, elsewise as binary in file storage

jsonData.description: Data to be sent as parsable string, can contain special placeholder. E. g. '{"subject1": "${data.subject}", "options1": {"host": "${data.host}"}}'

data.description: Data to be sent as JSON.

openUrl.description: if true - open URL in new tab, if response contains attribute openUrl, like {"openUrl": "http://1.2.3.4:80/aaa", "window": "_blank", "saveConfig": true}. If saveConfig is true, the user will be requested to save the configuration.

onLoaded.description: if true - execute the button logic once initially

useNative.description: if adapter returns result with `native` attribute it will be used for configuration. If `saveConfig` is true, the user will be requested to save the configuration

showProcess.description: Show spinner while request is in progress

encrypted.description: Is value encrypted or not (of course only for texts)

repeat.description: Password must be compared with password

visible.description: True if allow to view the password by toggling the view button

step.description: Step size for increase and decrease buttons

freeSolo.description: Set freeSolo to true so the textbox can contain any arbitrary value.

options.description: Options which can be completed. ["value1", "value2", ...] or [{"value": "value", "label": "Value1"}, "value2", ...]

complex.description: Show CRON with "minutes", "seconds" and so on

trim.description: If text must be trimmed or not (default = true)

minRows.description: default is 1. Set this attribute to `2` or more if you want to have a textarea with more than one row

maxRows.description: max rows of textarea. Used only if `minRows` > 1

readOnly.description: Shows text as read only field

noClearButton.description: Do not show a clear button

validateJson.description: if true, the text will be validated as JSON

allowEmpty.description: if true, the JSON will be validated only if the value is not empty

hidden.description: JS function that could use `native.attribute` for calculation

group.description: Is it a group or not

multiple.description: If true, multiple values can be selected

showAllValues.description: Show item even if no label was found for it (by multiple), default=`true`

pattern.description: Read-only field with pattern like 'https://${data.ip}:${data.port}' (will not be saved in config)

okText.description: Alert that will be shown by pressing the button

data.description: The data to be encoded in the QR Code

size.description: The size of the QR code

narrow.description: With this flag, the value will appear just after the label

addColon.description: Add to label the colon at the end if not exist in label

blinkOnUpdate.description: Value should blink when updated (true or color)

blink.description: Value should blink continuously (true or color)

copyToClipboard.description: Show copy to clipboard button for value

adapter.description: Name of the adapter. With special name _dataSources you can get all adapters with flag common.getHistory

adapters.description: Optional list of adapters, that should be shown. If not defined, all adapters will be shown. Only active if adapter attribute is not defined.

allowDeactivate.description: If true. Additional option "deactivate" is shown

onlyEnabled.description: If true. Only enabled instances will be shown

long.description: Value will look like system.adapter.ADAPTER.0 and not ADAPTER.0

short.description: Value will look like 0 and not ADAPTER.0

all.description: Add to the options ALL option with value *

delimiter.description: Delimiter for options. If no delimiter, the setting will be stored as array

types.description: Filter for one of the possible types: 'channel', 'device', ... (is state by default)

root.description: Show only this root object and its children

customFilter.description: Cannot be used together with `types` settings. Example: `{type: ['channel', 'device']}` - show only channels and devices

uuid.description: If UUID must be checked too

format.description: Format passed to the date picker

views.description: Configure which views should be shown to the users

timeSteps.description: Represent the available time steps for each view

returnFormat.description: Use `fullDate` or `HH:mm:ss`. Defaults to full date for backward compatibility reasons.

divider.description: divider between latitude and longitude. Default "," (Used if longitudeName and latitudeName are not defined)

autoInit.description: init field with current coordinates if empty

longitudeName.description: if defined, the longitude will be stored in this attribute, divider will be ignored

latitudeName.description: if defined, the latitude will be stored in this attribute, divider will be ignored

useSystemName.description: if defined, the checkbox with "Use system settings" will be shown and latitude, longitude will be read from system.config, a boolean will be saved to the given name

defaultSendTo.description: Command to request initial value from running instance

xs.description: width in 1/12 of screen on very small screens

sm.description: Width in 1/12 of screen on small screen

md.description: width in 1/12 of screen on middle screens

lg.description: width in 1/12 of screen on large screens

xl.description: width in 1/12 of screen on extra large screens

newLine.description: Should be shown from new line

hidden.description: JS function that could use 'native.attribute' for calculation

hideOnlyControl.description: If hidden the place will be shown, but no control

disabled.description: JS function that could use 'native.attribute' for calculation

style.description: CSS style in react notation: 'radiusBorder' and not 'radius-border'

darkStyle.description: CSS style for dark mode in react notation: 'radiusBorder' and not 'radius-border'

validator.description: JS function: true no error, false - error

validatorNoSaveOnError.description: True if save must be disabled by errors

validatorErrorText.description: Text to show if validator fails

showSecondAddAt.description: The number of lines from which the second add button at the bottom of the table will be shown. Default 5

showFirstAddOnTop.description: Show first plus button on top of the first column and not on the left.

ignoreOwnChanges.description: Do not trigger onChange event if changed value of this attribute

defaultFunc.description: JS function to calculate default value

noTranslation.description: Do not translate selects or other options (not for help, label or placeholder)

condition.description: JS function: true show confirm dialog

alsoDependsOn.description: Trigger confirm dialog if one of the components changed.

noMultiEdit.description: (only custom) if this flag set to true, this field will not be shown if user selected more than one object for edit

maxLength.description: max length of text in field

items.description: Consists of objects representing e.g. a single tab

system.description: Allow the usage of the system language from system.config as default

jsonData.description: Data to be sent as parsable string, can contain special placeholder. E. g. '{"subject1": "${data.subject}", "options1": {"host": "${data.host}"}}'

data.description: Data to be sent as JSON.

freeSolo.description: Set freeSolo to true so the textbox can contain any arbitrary value.

crop.description: If true, allow user to crop the image (only for non svg)

square.description: Width must be equal to height or crop must allow only square as shape

#include.description: Include other JSON or JSON5 file. Here is the name of the file with extension. E.g. 'options.jsonConfig.json' for 'anyName.jsonConfig.json5'

crop.description: If true, allow user to crop the image (only for non svg)

square.description: Width must be equal to height or crop must allow only square as shape

base64.description: If true, the image will be saved as data-url in attribute, elsewise as binary in file storage

freeSolo.description: Set freeSolo to true so the textbox can contain any arbitrary value.

options.description: Options which can be completed. ["value1", "value2", ...] or [{"value": "value", "label": "Value1"}, "value2", ...]

hidden.description: JS function that could use `native.attribute` for calculation

multiple.description: If true, multiple values can be selected

showAllValues.description: Show item even if no label was found for it (by multiple), default=`true`

noDelete.description: If delete or add disabled, If noDelete is false, add, delete and move up/down should work

uniqueColumns.description: Specify the 'attr' name of columns which need to be unique

export.description: If export button should be shown. Export as csv file.

import.description: If import button should be shown. Import from csv file.

clone.description: If clone button should be shown. If true, the clone button will be shown. If attribute name, this name will be unique.

encryptedAttributes.description: These items will be encrypted before saving with simple (not SHA) encryption method

pattern.description: Read-only field with pattern like 'https://${data.ip}:${data.port}' (will not be saved in config)

okText.description: Alert that will be shown by pressing the button

narrow.description: With this flag, the value will appear just after the label

addColon.description: Add to label the colon at the end if not exist in label

blinkOnUpdate.description: Value should blink when updated (true or color)

blink.description: Value should blink continuously (true or color)

copyToClipboard.description: Show copy to clipboard button for value

delimiter.description: Delimiter for options. If no delimiter, the setting will be stored as array

uuid.description: If UUID must be checked too

noDelete.description: If delete or add disabled, If noDelete is false, add, delete and move up/down should work

clone.description: If clone button should be shown. If true, the clone button will be shown. If attribute name, this name will be unique.

defaultSendTo.description: Command to request initial value from running instance

allowSaveWithError.description: Allow saving of configuration even if the instance is offline. Used with defaultSendTo

xs.description: width in 1/12 of screen on very small screens

sm.description: Width in 1/12 of screen on small screen

md.description: width in 1/12 of screen on middle screens

lg.description: width in 1/12 of screen on large screens

xl.description: width in 1/12 of screen on extra large screens

newLine.description: Should be shown from new line

hidden.description: JS function that could use 'native.attribute' for calculation

hideOnlyControl.description: If hidden the place will be shown, but no control

disabled.description: JS function that could use 'native.attribute' for calculation

style.description: CSS style in react notation: 'radiusBorder' and not 'radius-border'

darkStyle.description: CSS style for dark mode in react notation: 'radiusBorder' and not 'radius-border'

innerStyle.description: CSS style in react notation: 'radiusBorder' and not 'radius-border'

validator.description: JS function: true no error, false - error

validatorNoSaveOnError.description: True if save must be disabled by errors

validatorErrorText.description: Text to show if validator fails

showSecondAddAt.description: Number of lines from which the second add button at the bottom of the table will be shown. Default 5

ignoreOwnChanges.description: Do not trigger onChange event if changed value of this attribute

defaultFunc.description: JS function to calculate default value

noTranslation.description: Do not translate selects or other options (not for help, label or placeholder)

condition.description: JS function: true show confirm dialog

alsoDependsOn.description: Trigger confirm dialog if on of the components changed.

noMultiEdit.description: (only custom) if this flag set to true, this field will not be shown if user selected more than one object for edit

expertMode.description: If this flag set to true, this field will be shown only if the expert mode is true

maxLength.description: max length of text in field

tabsStyle.description: CSS styles in ReactJS notation: 'radiusBorder' and not 'radius-border'
